article: My two-year-old daughter Kate wanted a dog. But I was too busy to buy one. One day, Kate ran in, shouting, "Mom! Come to see my dog!" Her face was red with _ . I followed her to the bush and found a _ ! He was hurt. Seeing me, he stood up _ ! I could see his teeth! God! My mouth felt _ . "Don't be afraid. That's mom. She loves you, too." Kate said. Then he became friendly. It was _ ! I _ to find my husband and told him about the wolf. We should have killed the wolf, _ Kate loved him. Besides, he was gentle to Kate. So we called the vet finally. Kate named the wolf Ralph _ she carried food to him every day. Later, Ralph got well. They played together in the daytime. At night, Ralph would return to the mountains. Sometimes he _ but came back several days later. On Kate's first day of school, we could see Ralph's _ . After the school bus left, Ralph lay by the side of the road and _ . When Kate returned, he got happy again. This _ throughout Kate's school years. Twelve _ passed. One day we heard that a she-wolf was killed. The other wolf was hurt and ran away. We were _ about Ralph. That night, Ralph returned with a wound . Sixteen-year-old Kate held his head and _ him. We hope he could come through. However, he _ . Kate cried. I noticed something strange in the bush-----two little yellow eyes! Ralph's _ ! Before he died, Ralph _ his child to us ! He knew he would be _ here, as he had been. Ralph, Ralph... I was _ . "Don't be afraid, little...Ralphie. That's mom. She loves you, too."
